Dr. Pearle Partial Knee Replacement
3. Find out if you qualify
Obtain An Evaluation Now

Living with Knee Pain and Considering Total Knee Replacement? Know your alternatives — less invasive knee resurfacing procedures exist and you may be a candidate! You can be evaluated by Dr Andrew Pearle, an international expert in knee surgery, to help determine which approach may be appropriate for you.
Jul 2010
HealthTap gets a home: 575 High St.

After several months at HealthTap's first headquarters (Ron Gutman's whiteboard-equipped home office), we opened our doors at 575 High Street in a Palo Alto office suite formerly occupied by the FBI. It was a suitable location for top secret development work. There we created the new concept of Interactive Health.
Sep 2010
The first ever Hacking 4 Health

HealthTap hosts the first ever health data-specific Hackathon with support from the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), the HHS CTO, and HealthTap fan Todd Park. Hundreds participated and 35 teams created 18 apps in less than 24 hours.
Dec 2010
Giving back for the holidays
Private Beta Launch

We opened our doors to a limited audience of new moms and expecting women at the end of 2010. After previewing technology to investors in Nov, we started with hand-picked users in late 2010 and received immediate, positive, and validating feedback.
Jan 2011
Planning the future

Following months of intense work to release HealthTap to our Beta community, we gathered for our first annual planning retreat to set our goals for 2011. The retreat helped spark many new ideas and established a roadmap and metrics for success.
Hello, Dr. Tappy!

We care about care and positivity. Dr. Tappy, the smiling image of the helpful physician, was created and immediately became an integral part of the HealthTap experience. Always helpful and happy, Dr. Tappy symbolizes HealthTap's dedication to providing the best, most reliable, health information to everyone at all times.
Feb 2011
:) we're on TED!

HealthTap CEO and Founder Ron Gutman's TED talk on the "Hidden Powers of Smiling" created buzz at the 2011 conference, but the ultimate success of the talk came when it was released online. Today, the talk has been viewed by millions, translated into more than 50 languages by enthusiastic viewers across the world and published as a TED book.
Walking healthy
Cool consumer health projects come with even cooler swag! Introducing the HealthTap shoe – if you see them on someone's feet, say hi!
Mar 2011
Angel funding announced

HealthTap's angels include some of the best and brightest company builders in Silicon Valley and beyond. Their backing of our shared vision enables us to create the HealthTap you see today. Read article ›
The first Interactive Health Symposium

HealthTap hosted the first Interactive Health Symposium right in our office, attracting physician participants from across the state. The symposium created the foundation for a robust, ongoing dialogue between HealthTap and the physician community about the innovations most needed in healthcare today.
Rocking Interactive Health at SXSW

HealthTap led in health innovation at the South by Southwest Interactive conference. Paving the way for a strong health presence at this important gathering, we hosted an interactive health meet-up to connect innovators, as well as a major gathering for the entire SXSW health community.
Our First Expert Answer
The first response to an inquiry on HealthTap came from a New Jersey pediatrician, Dr. Anatoloy Belilovsky, who answered the question: "Should I be concerned about my baby's previous vaccinations?"
Apr 2011
Public beta launch

Following our Beta launch, we opened our virtual doors to the public on Apr 19, 2011, revealing to the world our labor of love. Press included praise in TIME and Forbes, among other national publications.
Our first member
HealthTap's first member outside of our invited Beta group signs up. The immediate adoption of our service by consumers around the country soon leads to users from other countries as well.
May 2011
One thousand doctors!

HealthTap proudly sponsors TEDx Silicon Valley, the most widely viewed TEDx event in the world, with live streaming audiences in 50 countries and more than 330,000 global views. The event, themed "Living by Numbers," focused on how numbers can impact and improve our daily lives and featured speakers like Chris Anderson, Mitch Kapor, and Tim O'Reilly.
June 2011
First internship class

Who better to share our first-hand experience in a growing start-up, building a world-class company, than top students from Stanford and beyond? HealthTap's Internship program is designed to provide a memorable educational experience to students interested in health technology and product development.
Jul 2011
We've moved! 101 University

A heated battle for conference room space marked the end of our tenure at our first offices in 575 High Street. We moved on up to an even better location - the former Facebook offices at 101 University Ave, Suite 100, right across from the Cal Train station in the hear of Palo Alto.
Gift horses

Working with and learning from horses was just one of the many benefits of a day celebrating our launch with a retreat in the wine country near Los Gatos. The event also included horseback riding and other equestrian activities.
Sep 2011
Mobile launch

"5,000 doctors, at your fingertips – at home or on the go" became the motto at launch for the new HealthTap Express App. Together with the physician-facing application (HealthTap Express MD), HealthTap's core Q&A functionality was captured in a novel and engaging mobile app.
Oct 2011
50,000 answers!

We reach 50,000 useful, relevant, and current physician-created answers on HealthTap, all available for free. The Medical Experts on HealthTap stay busy improving the quality of online health information one answer, tip, and health guide at a time.
Nov 2011
HealthTap Groups

It's not just for individual physicians anymore! Group practices, hospitals, and other health organizations join HealthTap. Now, these groups can maintain a presence on HealthTap and connect with individual physicians. Five hundred physicians now participate in groups. Read article ›
Dec 2011
Series A

HealthTap is awarded $11.5M in Series A funding, from investors like the Mayfield Fund, Mohr Davidow Ventures, and Eric Schmidt's Innovation Endeavors. Their backing of our shared vision enables us to continue to build the HealthTap that you see today.
Re-treat

The team hits Carmel for the weekend on the second annual company retreat. There, we brainstormed about where HealthTap should go from here and generally how to change the world to help people smile and feel good!
Jan 2012
100,000 agrees!

When doctors feel that an answer from another physician is right on target, they can "agree" with it - immediately boosting the credibility of the answer. The answer with the most agrees is bumped to the top for users to find!
Feb 2012
10,000 doctors!

Our Medical Expert Network reached 10,000 doctors in early 2012 – and it's still growing! This milestone coincided with Valentine's Day, when we launched our "I <3 My Doc" campaign - celebrating physicians everywhere for their hard work and dedication to the care of others.
Mar 2012
Our second SXSW 2012 Interactive Conference

HealthTap hosts the hottest Interactive Health gathering at SXSW, with more than 2,000 people on the wait list. Participants enjoyed party perks like big wheel racing and a photo booth, while simultaneously driving the mobile health movement forward.
Super happy Developer Block Party

HealthTap's award-winning display at the first-ever Developer Block Party (sponsored by the city of Palo Alto) featured in-person doctors answering health questions of the thousands of people who stopped by our "Doctor is In" parklet.
Jun 2012
Fourth internship class

HealthTap's fourth internship class brought together a diverse array of students from Stanford, Berkeley, USC, and UCLA--students who added to the excitement and energy around what HealthTap is doing for the health world.
12,000 doctors!

Our Medical Expert Network continued its remarkable growth, reaching 12,000 U.S.-licensed doctors in Jun 2012. These doctors are actively engaging with HealthTap members and contributing to the world’s leading knowledgebase of online health content.
Jul 2012
Launch of the New HealthTap

The New HealthTap launched as the first-ever mobile health platform, available for everyone (iPhone, iPad, Android and Web). We received positive praise from Washington Post , Bloomberg, Reuters, Forbes and Mashable, as well as TechCrunch and GigaOm among many other well known publications.
Nov 2012
DocScore highlights top doctors

HealthTap’s innovative DocScore is an objective numeric rating (like a FICO score) for doctors, taking into account public information (such as years in practice, medical education, awards, and peer-reviewed publications) as well as interactions on HealthTap (including peer-endorsements and agrees).

HealthTap’s DOConnect is an interactive map showing the referral network of doctors and doctors who treat the same patients at the same time. More than 30 million connections are visible via HealthTap, and each doctor’s connections are visible directly from a doctor’s HealthTap profile page.
HealthTap acquires Avvo Health and grows Directory to 1.2 million doctors

HealthTap’s first acquisition, health Q&A and directory service Avvo Health, expanded HealthTap’s Medical Expert Network to more than 40,000 doctors in 128 specialties, and broadened local coverage across all 50 states. At the same time, HealthTap announced the expansion of its directory coverage to include 1.2 million U.S.-licensed doctors. Read article ›
Disrupting healthcare for the better
HealthTap CEO Ron Gutman was invited to present on CNBC’s “The Disrupters,” a national news series highlighting innovative companies and individuals changing the status quo.
Dec 2012
Health resolutions health journey

HealthTap's new interface makes it easy and intuitive to browse health information, helping users support their health journeys. New features include health resolutions and a body browser, an easy way to explore symptoms and related conditions and treatments, all by clicking on an image of the human body.
Jan 2013
CNN : HealthTap helps you keep resolutions

CNN highlighted HealthTap as one of the very best apps to help you keep your New Year's health resolutions. The video feature aired on CNN during prime time, and was simulcast on 150 stations across the country. Watch video ›
Winter retreat envisions HealthTap’s next generation

HealthTap team members gathered in Northern California for our semi-annual retreat, where we hosted a select group of doctors from diverse practices across the country. They participated in activities that helped us envision the next generation of HealthTap.
Feb 2013

HealthTap brings doctor-created tips straight to your mobile device or computer. To keep healthy living top of mind, users can subscribe to health topics of interest, and receive daily doctor-created tips, suggestions, or bits of advice delivered via email or by SMS push notifications to mobile devices. Users can also discover and browse TipTaps on HealthTap.
Global mobile featuring!
HealthTap, featured globally on Google Play’s Android app market, quickly becomes one of the top 10 most popular health apps worldwide.
Mar 2013
HealthTap personalized!

Mar 2013 also marked the availability of increased personalization to millions on the HealthTap platform. Now when members ask questions, they are prompted with the option to add additional personal information related to the question they are asking. This provides doctors with relevant context and improves the specificity of the answers members receive.
One of the Top Four Out of 40,000 Apps!
In Mar 2013, HealthTap was featured on the TODAY Show as one of the four best health apps from among the 40,000 health applications available for consumers. Watch video ›
Mar 2013
Experts Helping Experts
This month HealthTap unveiled its new initiative called “Curbside Consults.” The program allows a HealthTap physician to use the platform’s network to broadcast a question to other physicians.
Apr 2013
The Full Spectrum release!
The full spectrum of doctor knowledge is made available via HealthTap. Doctor-to-doctor Q&A, concise doctor updates, and full-length doctor posts are released.
Growth!
HealthTap reaches 7.5 million monthly unique visitors, two million app downloads, and more than half a billion doctor answers served.
May 2013
AppRX

In May 2013, HealthTap launched AppRX so our users can get app recommendations from real doctors. With AppRX, we make it fast and easy to find health and wellness apps by creating intuitive, user-friendly categories, and posting doctor recommendations and written reviews. Read article ›
Jul 2013
Health2020 Event

In the summer of 2013, HealthTap had the pleasure of hosting a group of leading engineers, designers, product managers, data experts, and innovators in diverse industries to envision and design the “future of health” in the year 2020. It was a successful day of thought-provoking debate and ideas of how to disrupt the health space.
First doctor conference with Top Doctors

July 2013 marked the first ever HealthTap Doctors’ Conference. Doctors from around the country from multiple specialities, practice sizes, and various stages in their careers offered insights and feedback on the past, present, and future of HealthTap.
Oct 2013
10,000 lives saved

In Oct 2013, HealthTap received the 10,000th user note telling us that information on HealthTap saved a life. By making digital health personal, we're working hard to help many more thousands all over the world live longer, healthier lives. Read article ›
One billion answers served

Since launching our mobile health platform in Jul 2012, we've served more than one billion answers in response to users' health questions, and have created and organized the world's most extensive knowledge base of user questions matched to answers from trusted doctors.
50,000 doctors

We were thrilled when the 50,000th doctor signed up to join our Medical Expert Network! The thank you notes keep pouring in from members who have been helped by our devoted and inspirational doctors. And the doctors are happy too! Word of mouth is spreading in the medical community about HealthTap and how it is helping millions of people around the world feel good!
Nov 2013

HealthTap Labs launches its first app - Talk To Docs. Just speak a question, and the app reads back answers from top doctors. Uses advanced natural language processing, artificial intelligence, and advanced voice recognition technology, Talk To Docs recognizes the health topics you’re interested in, and delivers the most appropriate answers. Read article ›
“Disrupting Healthcare”

HealthTap continued to be featured in national press, with articles in Inc. Magazine (November 2013) and Forbes (November 2013), among many others celebrating the changes that HealthTap is making in the health field.
Feb 2014
HealthTap Documentary

A mini-documentary on HealthTap was released underscoring the importance of the company’s mission to revolutionize the doctor-patient relationship. The film featured patients and doctors who spoke about the deep impact HealthTap is having on their lives. Watch video ›
June 2014
HealthTap launches a smartwatch app
HealthTap redefines healthcare once again and becomes first health app on Google’s Android wear. Now millions around the world get the power of personalized doctor reminders and tips on the go!
Jul 2014
HealthTap moves into 270 University Ave
We move to a new, bigger, better, sunnier office in the heart of downtown Palo Alto!
HealthTap launches HealthTap Prime

Using HealthTap Prime, doctors can make Virtual House Calls via video chats, regular phone calls, or message exchanges. Members of HealthTap+ Prime can request a Virtual House Call at anytime, from anyplace, using any PC or mobile device.
Aug 2014
Doctor house calls are making a come-back with a high-tech twist
The launch of HealthTap Prime received worldwide media coverage, including a feature on Good Morning America!
Two billion!
HealthTap hits two billion answers served in response to users' health questions.
Sep 2014
HealthTap launches on Apple’s Health App

HealthTap launched on Apple’s Health App, providing a seamless way to get your data from device to doctor. Doctors can use the Apple Health App data to provide better recommendations, as well as actionable doctor-created checklists and personalized tips.
Oct 2014
HealthTap launches HealthTap Concierge

With HealthTap Concierge, you can connect with your own doctor from anywhere via video or text consults for a low per-consult fee. No monthly subscription required. Create your own 24/7 Care-Team and get a 2nd, 3rd, or 10th opinion from doctors in more than 100 specialties!
Jan 2015
First AppRx Annual Report

HealthTap releases its first annual report on the top health and medical apps available today. Thousands of doctors on HealthTap independently reviewed tens of thousands of health apps and provided recommendations for some of the ones they deemed the best among the 100,000 health and wellness apps available in the iOS and Android app stores.
Mar 2015
RateRx Launched

HealthTap launches RateRx, the first large-scale resource created by doctors to help consumers understand the effectiveness of drugs and treatments based on doctor’s real-world experience with medications. RateRx empowers more informed discussions between patients and doctors about treatment options.
Apr 2015
20,000th “life saved” thank-you note!
HealthTap received the 20,000th note from a customer telling us that information on HealthTap saved a life.
Three new apps for Apple Watch

HealthTap remains on the forefront of digital health by being offering the first consumer healthcare apps for Apple Watch. DocNow, the first “Affordable Care App,” delivers instant access to doctors on call 24/7 for only $2.99. HealthTap for Apple Watch helps you stay on top of your health with a tap on your wrist. HealthTap for Doctors lets doctors to manage their Virtual Practices right from their Apple Watches.
Three billion answers served
HealthTap crosses three billion answers served in response to users' health questions.
May 2015
HealthTap wins Webby Award
HealthTap wins the 2015 Webby Award—called “The Internet’s highest honor” by the New York Times—in the Mobile Sites & Apps: Health & Fitness Category.
Jun 2015
E-prescriptions now available!
HealthTap announces its collaboration with Quest Diagnostics to enable doctors to order diagnostic testing services for patients.
Aug 2015
World Economic Forum Technology Pioneer
The World Economic Forum selects HealthTap as 2015 Technology Pioneer for its significant global potential to make virtual healthcare accessible to everyone.
Sep 2015
HealthTap Compass gives employees of Flex access to efficient, world-class healthcare

HealthTap launches Compass, a revolutionary new personal healthcare application that will give employees of Flex the ability to “tap in” to intelligent and cost-effective healthcare 24/7. HealthTap Compass serves as a hub for managing all employees’ healthcare needs, from information to prescriptions and even lab test referrals and interpretations, and will replace the traditional “benefits card.”
Oct 2015
HealthTap goes global

HealthTap expands globally, unveiling its new “Health Operating System™ (HOPES)™" for hospitals, clinics, and community-based programs worldwide, starting with the Waikato District Health Board in New Zealand.
250 million people helped!
More than 250 million users have accessed HealthTap doctors’ expertise in the form of answers and curated articles from the world’s largest doctor-created knowledgebase.
Nov 2015
Global Rounds: groundbreaking social learning for doctors

Clinicians around the world can receive continuing medical education (CME) credits for answering patient questions, providing peer review on other doctor answers, and participating in discussions about challenging medical cases in HealthTap Global Rounds, the only digital learning where doctors can collaboratively solve real patient cases with other top doctors.
Jan 2016
HealthTap SOS offers solution for disaster relief

HealthTap now helps victims of natural disasters and terrorist attacks with HealthTap SOS, which it plans to license to municipalities and insurance firms around the world. In case of an emergency such as a hurricane or tsunami, residents of an affected area will be able to text, call, or video chat in real time with one of HealthTap's network of more than 100,000 doctors. The company will aggregate data based on these interactions pushing it back to relief forces, as well as to the government and to global media outlets.
Mar 2016
100,000 Doctors!

More than 100,000 U.S. licensed doctors have joined HealthTap in its virtual care revolution, enabling people everywhere to access quality care from any mobile device or personal computer, and for doctors to deliver care at anytime from anywhere.
4.5 billion answers served!
HealthTap hits four and a half billion answers served in response to users' health questions.
Apr 2016
First-of-its-kind doctor training and certification in virtual care
Doctors can now get official continuing medical education (CME) credits for updating their expertise to include delivering virtual care.
HealthTap chat bot for Facebook's Messenger app

HealthTap was the only health-focused company to be invited by Facebook to create a chat bot for the new Facebook Messenger app. HealthTap’s bot allows users to type a question into Messenger any time and receive free responses from doctors.
May 2016
Partnership with New Zealand’s Waikato District Health Board offers virtual care to rural residents

Based on HealthTap HOPES™, New Zealand’s first “virtual hospital” gives more than one million patients the ability to talk to their doctors via video, audio, or text chat rather than travel to an distant outpatient clinic, improving both access and health outcomes for the Waikato population.
Jul 2016
HealthTap acquires Docphin, brings comprehensive medical education to doctors for free

By acquiring Docphin, a prime educational service for doctors and an emerging go-to resource for new publications in the medical literature, HealthTap can guide doctors to the latest developments and provide them with personalized alerts and updates on topics relevant to their specialties and expertise.
Aug 2016
Group virtual consults with live translators

HealthTap begins offering virtual consults that include multiple participants such as family members, caregivers, specialists, and live translators. This breakthrough service removes language barriers and dramatically expands access to high-quality, immediate care to HealthTap users in 174 countries around the world.

Your Allergies Can Be Treated Today!

You are not alone. 50 million people in the United States suffer from allergy symptoms and its prevalence is increasing, affecting as many as 30 percent of adults and up to 40 percent of children. Allergies can be frustrating and can be an annoyance if not properly treated. At HealthTap, we have licensed qualified doctors who can help make you feel good! We're here 24/7, to help with prescriptions, treatment and advice. What are you waiting for?
Connect with a doctor in under two minutes today and alleviate those allergy frustrations!
Get Help with Your Flu/Cold Symptoms Now!

Achoo! Being sick can make you feel helpless and alone. Sometimes, all you need is a quick doctor chat to get a basic prescription, but you don't want to deal with the hassles of the waiting room. With HealthTap, you can talk to a doctor in under 2 minutes from the comfort of your own bed!
What are you waiting for? Talk to a doctor in less time than it takes to drive there!
Talk to a Doctor Privately Now!
Questions about STDs? HealthTap doctors can offer private confidential advice for your condition. Doctors are standing by 24/7 to offer help, treatment and prescriptions.
Connect with a doctor in minutes in the privacy of your home! Get Confidential Help Now
A Doctor is Standing by to Answer All Your Pregnancy Questions Now!

Pregnancy is a beautiful but complicated process. There are thousands of questions every parent wants to ask but frequently forgets during regular doctor visits. With HealthTap, you can have a doctor on demand anytime, anywhere!
Connect with a doctor in minutes via phone, tablet or computer, 24/7. We're here to help and make sure you and your newborn feel good! Try us today!
Get Treatment for Your Skin Condition Now!

Skin conditions result from a number of factors and can reduce your quality of life. It's important to have a doctor evaluate your condition to ensure it is not something more serious than a minor irritation. At HealthTap, you can connect to a doctor in minutes via chat or video to get peace of mind!
Doctors are standing by 24/7 for advice, treatment or prescriptions. Get help today!

SmartHealth Privacy Statement
Secure Sharing: HealthTap

On HealthTap you can ask health questions, connect with doctors, get trusted answers and tips, and explore health information without also sharing your personal identity. We call this "secure sharing."

How does it work? On HealthTap, only you know who you are. Your identity is protected. Our community receives the value of learning from your questions and the information you choose to share, and you benefit from the secure sharing of others in our community. You can even personalize your questions without revealing your identity.
is written in easy to read language. We even provided additional suggestions for sharing securely and safeguarding your privacy when participating on HealthTap.
Our company culture respects the values of secure sharing. Our employees receive privacy training, and our

is straightforward and easy to understand. It contains answers to common questions about how our service works and how information provided to us is used and protected.
We take your privacy and security very seriously. Our

We also have a Privacy Constitution, consisting of our pledge to you and your rights. This Constitution helps guide our decisions about privacy and security, and secures your rights as a member of our service.
HealthTap's Privacy Constitution & Member Bill of Rights

We are here to help you connect with doctors and find helpful health information including useful answers from trusted doctors. We ask only for data that can help us provide this service to you, and to use the data provided to improve your experience on our service.

We will keep the personal information that you provide to us safe and secure. Our data security practices always meet or exceed industry standards. We use technology, policies, and conduct, together with a privacy-centered company culture, to ensure that your data is safe.
Our experience is designed to keep your information anonymous and secure. You can add, remove, update, or request a connection to the personal and health information in your Profile at any time (see

Sharing is a matter of personal choice. Other than registration information, you are not required to share any information with us to use HealthTap. You share what you want, when you want, and sharing is not required to use HealthTap.
You have the right to know what Personally Identifiable Information we collect and how it is used. Our sharing preferences are transparent and our Privacy Statement discloses this information.

I loved my internship at HealthTap. I wanted to experience what a startup was like and do something really transformative in Health. I felt like I wasn't just another intern, and what I did really mattered. Now, I'm so happy to be a part of the full-time team and continue my experience at HealthTap.

The best thing about being at HealthTap is that everyone is so passionate and always willing to take time to explain their specific projects. I've learned a lot about the intersection of social media and healthcare and believe that HealthTap is redefining the way people think about doctor- patient interactions.

As an intern at HealthTap, I have realized that HealthTap's number one goal really is to make the world a better place by making relevant health information accessible to everybody. The people that work at HealthTap are some of the most optimistic and caring people that I have met.

These values reflect who we are, both as individuals and as a company. We discuss these values at every team meeting and measure ourselves against them at every opportunity to do so. They guide who we hire and how we work together. They shape the decisions we make and how we grow.

We're committed to creating a healthier, happier world — one person at a time. To accomplish this, we provide people with reliable, personal health information and trusted answers to real health questions. Our goal is to support doctors and other health experts in helping people make the best possible health decisions.

We envision a world where people everywhere can quickly find reliable answers to their health questions, and easily get access to the best experts that will guide them towards a healthier happier life. We envision a future where people can tap into their personal health information, using HealthTap, to manage their health and well-being, feel good and thrive. We are realizing this vision by helping connect people with trustworthy doctors, online and offline, and by improving the quality of care, while saving time and lowering the costs of care.

Our first responsibility is to do good for the individuals who use HealthTap, especially when making decisions that affect their health and the health of their loved ones. We care deeply about people and are committed to providing information that meets the highest standards of safety and validity.
We value and honor the trust of those who use HealthTap. We treat the personal information of individuals with the utmost care and maintain the highest standards of privacy and security.

We believe in collaboration and recognize that partnership is integral to realizing our vision. We are committed to being a great partner, and to attracting and retaining the world's best organizations and institutions as collaborators.

We care about our partners' needs and interests and we are committed to their success. We believe that active listening, transparency and trust are central to creating effective, long-term partnerships.

We are committed to creating and maintaining a place where our employees love to work. We are responsible for ensuring that our employees are treated with care and respect, and that they are challenged to achieve their potential.

We believe that work can be play, and that working hard toward a worthy goal is one of the most fulfilling ways to spend our time. We believe that happy, fulfilled employees who share a commitment to changing the world will bring forth the creativity and passion needed to fulfill our vision.
. We believe that being kind is central to living a healthy life, and having a healthy company. However we may differ in our ideas, approaches and perspectives, caring for one another unites us.

. We believe that being open and transparent facilitates collaboration and teamwork and creates a constructive environment in which the best ideas flourish, regardless of their origins. We believe that openness and transparency, together with integrity and honesty, form the foundation of trust required for our success.

. We believe that as a team we can achieve far more than as a group of individuals, and that the best ideas are developed through a collaborative process. We enjoy interacting with one another and believe that our connection is central to our strength.

. We believe that something worth doing is worth doing right. We hold ourselves to the highest standards and consistently aim to excel. We like to win, and we love to learn. We enjoy challenging ourselves and strive for personal mastery.

. We believe that the world is changed by passionate people who channel positive energy toward a vision they believe in. Positive energy fuels our progress and brings joy to our journey by helping us endure, see beyond, and overcome challenges and difficulties.
. We believe that 'work' can feel like play, and strive to find and bring into each day playfulness, fun and joy.

. We believe that childlike wonder fuels creativity, and we are driven by a desire to create the new. We look for new ways of acting, and are not anchored to how things have been done in the past. We question assumptions and the status quo, and ask tough questions that are not easily answered.

. We are driven by changing the world and making a meaningful difference in the lives of millions of people everywhere. In order to achieve our goals, we are focused on driving short term measurable milestones that add up to long term real impact.

. We are on a mission to create a healthier world, and we recognize that this starts at home. We pledge to take care of our own health and well-being, and to help others do the same. In large and small ways, we strive to help everyone with whom we interact improve their health and well-being.

. We believe that simple is better, and strive to reduce complexity to its essence. We believe that with good work, any idea can be described on a napkin, and that the effort required to simplify something to its essence is worthwhile.

. We believe that facts and data in context lead to better, truly personalized decisions and improved outcomes. Whenever possible, we will use facts, data, and information as the language of our internal discussions and as the basis for our decisions. When a strong opinion and fact are in opposition, burden of proof will rest on the opinion.

. We believe that the feeling of being on a mission will help us achieve a greater purpose with our work. As with any adventure, we will take risks and embrace failures, but always learn from our mistakes to make us better. The path to success has its ups and downs and requires a fearless spirit. But most importantly, we recognize that the journey is as rewarding as the destination.

Modern medicine and healthcare too often emphasize “health” over “care,” focusing more on treatments and medications than on the human aspect of care. As patients, we also have very few opportunities to show our deep appreciation and gratitude for the doctors who give us hope and help us at some of our most challenging of times.

“Thanks doc!” is multimedia art installation taking viewers on a symbolic journey of care and gratitude, and highlighting the impact of caring for others by sharing knowledge and showing compassion. The piece uses actual words of thanks that patients have shared with doctors, demonstrating the often unspoken appreciation we feel for the doctors who help us overcome adversity, and who tend to us when we need it most.

These expressions of deep, true thanks were posted by real patients on HealthTap’s iPhone, Android, and iPad apps, and online on healthtap.com. The doctors in the exhibit are part of HealthTap’s rapidly growing Medical Expert Network.

The series of 18 panels (above) combines images of helpful doctors with real patient thank you notes. The installation was first displayed at the Stanford MedicineX Conference at the Stanford School of Medicine on September 29–30, 2012.
Patients, share your thanks for a doctor who's made a difference in your life. Doctors, share notes of appreciation from your patients.
Submit your thanks today

This simple act goes a long way toward improving your mood and the mood of those around you, reducing stress and spreading happiness in a fantastic and contagious way. This is why we’ve made sure to incorporate this positive energy into what we build for you.
In 2011, our Founder & CEO, Ron Gutman gave a TED Talk on the hidden power of smiling. Within weeks of becoming available online, it became one of the most "liked” TED talks of all time.

by Ron Gutman brings together even more unique findings from his deep research of the science and history of smiling, with anecdotes from his outreach to social media and his travels around the world. The book reveals the astonishing benefits that smiling can produce for you and for others, and includes tips for how to bring more smiles into your life and to the lives of others.
Smile: The Astonishing Powers of a Simple Act
Ron is HealthTap's Founder and CEO. He is responsible for the company's innovation, vision and product.

Ron is also an avid public speaker and writer, frequently presenting at health and technology conferences (such as TED, SXSW and Health 2.0) and contributing pieces about technology, health and smiling in leading publications (such as Forbes, the Huffington Post, and TEDBooks). Additionally, he serves as the Curator of TEDx Silicon Valley.

As a graduate student at Stanford University, Ron organized and led a multidisciplinary group of faculty and graduate students conducting research in personalized health and in the design of ways to help people live healthier, happier lives. The group's work resulted in the implementation of one of the most acclaimed and engaging employee health and well-being programs in the nation, BeWell@Stanford.

In addition to his passion for health and well-being, Ron is passionate about smiling. After discovering the transformative potential of smiling in his own life, he began to research the benefits of smiling for the self, others, and changing social situations for the better. His research and learnings on the Hidden Powers of Smiling are chronicled in a TED Talk, an article on Forbes.com and a TED book .

Ron is HealthTap's Founder and CEO. He's responsible for the company's innovation, vision, and product. Prior to founding HealthTap, Ron was the founder and CEO of a leading online consumer health 2.0 company that developed the world's largest community of independent health writers and became one of the largest health sites on the Internet, serving more than 100 million users (acquired in early 2009).
Co-Founder & Chief Medical Information Officer

Geoff is HealthTap's co-founder and Chief Medical Information Officer. He is responsible for the architecture of HealthTap's Medical Knowledge Base. Prior to joining HealthTap, Geoff served as the Chief Medical Officer and the Executive Vice President of Product Development at ePocrates, as the Chief Medical Officer of Wellsphere, and created the first consumer health site at Healtheon (WebMD). Additionally, Geoff has served as the Chief of Medical Informatics in Emergency Medicine for Harvard University teaching hospital Beth Israel, and on the clinical faculty in Emergency Medicine at Stanford University and UCSD.

Sean is HealthTap’s Head of Product. He is responsible for taking product ideas and feedback from concept to market, and into the hands of millions of patients and doctors around the world. Sean is an engineer, designer, and serial technology entrepreneur. Prior to HealthTap, Sean was the co-founder of PayoutHub, a social game-monetization platform (acquired in 2009), and the co-founder and COO of GXStudios (GoCrossCampus and PickTeams), a venture-backed pioneer of online team-based casual games. Sean has also worked with leading health and technology firms. Sean also co-founded and led the Yale Entrepreneurial Institute, the University’s official incubator and fellowship program for entrepreneurs. Sean has a technical background in UIUX development and design, and holds inventions in the fields of oral drug delivery, urinary incontinence, genetic testing, and polymer nanocomposites.
Sean holds an M.B.A. from Stanford Graduate School of Business and a B.S. (with Distinction) in Biomedical Engineering from Yale University.
Co-Founder & CTO

Sastry is HealthTap's co-founder and CTO. He is responsible for HealthTap's innovative technology platform. Prior to joining HealthTap, Sastry served as Chief Technology Officer and Executive Vice President at Wellsphere, the CTO of HealthCentral, and the former Director of Software Development at Microvision. Sastry has lead technology teams to build market-leading products and tools, including ERwin, the world's most popular data modeling software.
Chief Privacy Officer, General Counsel, & Business Development Director

Michael is HealthTap's Chief Privacy Officer, General Counsel, and Business Development Director. He is responsible for HealthTap's privacy and legal policies, the company’s legal affairs, and for HealthTap’s business development. For over a dozen years, Michael has provided legal counsel and services to innovative technology companies, from early-stage startups to Fortune 100 companies. Prior to joining HealthTap, Michael served as an attorney with national law firms in Silicon Valley, as general counsel to high technology companies, and as pro-bono counsel to Singularity University. Additionally, Michael has served as a Judge Pro Tem in Santa Clara County, and as a judicial clerk in the Washington D.C. Court of Appeals. At Yale Law School, Michael was an editor of the
Michael holds A.B. (honors) and M.A. degrees from Stanford University, and a J.D. from the Yale Law School.

Dr. Jeff Livingston is HealthTap's Medical Director. He is a national thought leader and speaker on doctor adoption of social media. He has been a doctor at MacArthur OB/GYN since 2003 in Irving, Texas. He previously served as Chairman of the Obstetrics and Gynecology Department at Baylor Medical Center of Irving. Several national publications, including USA Today, Wired magazine, Computerworld.com and Physicians Practice have featured his combined use of Facebook, Twitter and a secure patient portal to effectively communicate with patients and to better meet their everyday healthcare needs.

Dr. Livingston serves on the Medical Advisory Board for HealthTap and he is the Chief Medical officer for Healthcare Transformation Solutions. He is on Twitter as @macobgyn and is an active doctor blogger.

Follow a doctor to receive their HealthTap answers, interactions and updates on your feed. You can also start a private conversation by sending the doctor a message or requesting an in-person appointment.
Did you find a particular doctor's answer helpful? Show them your appreciation with just one click by thanking them. You'll also have the opportunity to provide a personalized thank you note.

Topic pages provide a general overview of a health topic, and reflect the collective wisdom of HealthTap Medical Experts. In addition to a description, you'll find links to relevant content (including Answers, Tips, and Health Guides) and to related Topics. Current Top Doctors for each Topic are featured on this page. You can add content to Health Guides, and even share content, directly from a Topic page.

If you can improve a description on HealthTap simply select "Edit description" and make your changes. These will take effect immediately, and you'll be identified as the most recent editor to the Topic description.
Let the doctor know what your requested visit concerns. You can even attach an image if you’d like.

All the responses to questions that have been answered appear on this page, where you can Thank experts, send Thank You Notes, and even Share the Answers that you appreciate. You can also add to your Health Activity and see Top Doctors on Related Topics.
Questions & Answers
All of the answers by Medical Experts appear below the question. Quickly browse the summary responses then read the detailed answers. The most relevant, highly ranked responses appear first.
Thank Medical Experts for the Answers that you appreciate. Thanking earns you points, and shows gratitude for the great health information provided.

After you Thank an Expert, you'll have an opportunity to add a Thank You Note. Thank You Notes show added appreciation, and experts can post these notes to their Virtual Practices. (Please do not include any questions or information in these notes, and only send what you agree can be publicly shared).

HealthTap’s now gives you instant access to the latest peer-reviewed medical research, together with insights about it and comments on it from the medical experts on HealthTap. Have a question about a published study? We’ve got you covered – you can send a public question to our network, or even ask the doctor of your choice a question about the research via a Private Conversation on HealthTap.
Want clarification? Ask a question about the article to our community of experts, or even enter into a Private Conversation about it with the doctor you choose.
Want to know what other doctors think of the research? Read the comments posted by medical experts, and learn what they have to say.
Want to learn more? Quickly find other related publications on HealthTap, including similar research or articles by the same authors.
Search & Ask
Points are a sign of your engagement on HealthTap and your engagement with your personal health. View your points directly from your home page. The higher your points, the more stars you'll have.

Select the doctor you’d like to ask a personal question to and start your private conversation. In this interaction, your real name, Health Profile and Health Activity will be shown to the doctor.

Once you submit your question, the doctor will be notified. When the doctor responds, you’ll be notified. This response will be visible only to you inside your Timeline. You or the doctor can attach images to the question. Private questions and answers are available for a small fee.
If you’d like to follow up with an additional question for this doctor, you can do so. Follow up messages to a private conversation are available at half price.

After you enter a search, similar questions and related information (including Answers, Tips, Health Guides, Topics, Medical Experts and members) are shown. If your question is new and hasn't been answered, you can submit it to our thousands of Medical Experts.

Asking a question for someone else? Want to share the answer? Enter their email addresses here and we’ll notify them when the question is answered.

Your Virtual Practice page is how users see you on HealthTap. It is the place where all of the expert content you create, Agree with, and curate appear. Your professional contact information and bio also appear here. This is the place to send existing and prospective patients to demonstrate your expertise.

Members can easily access relevant information that you share under five tabs: Answers, Tips & Health Guides (the content you've created), Feed (your HealthTap activity and the activity of your network), Network (your Network), About (your professional contact information and your accomplishments), and Award Wall (the Awards and Thanks you've received).

Your statistics are a reflection of your engagement on HealthTap. Raising your stats raises your rank among your peers and enhances your Trust Score, which helps get you featured to new and existing patients.

Your Virtual Practice is the place where you can create content and interact with others on HealthTap. From here you can answer questions and see your latest activity. You can also Agree with content created by other experts and refer questions to them, as well as see recently active colleagues, and invite colleagues to join you on HealthTap.
Your points and level indicate how active and engaged you are on HealthTap. Your activity level determines your visibility and reputation on HealthTap.

Build your Virtual Practice while creating professional consensus around the best content on HealthTap. Agreeing with answers adds them to your Virtual Practice and helps them become more visible to members and other experts.
Message & Recommend

HealthTap recognizes that most doctors have several areas of practice that they are “known for” based on past training or cumulative clinical experience. Therefore we enable you to attract patients to your practice based on up to 5 Known for topics that can be changed at any time. You can also vote your colleagues up in specific categories to improve their standings.
Promote Your Research

Highlight your published studies, add a user-friendly description of the findings, and even answer user questions about it (including Private Conversation requests). You can also add comments to any other published study on HealthTap.
Build your network of referring doctors and patients on HealthTap. This is one of the top ways to grow your DocScore and gain more visibility.
Thanks & Agrees

HealthTap’s new Publications feature expands the reach of your expertise. Studies in peer-reviewed publications are now highlighted on HealthTap, directly from your Virtual Practice. Your research will be highlighted to Members looking for related health information on HealthTap, and you can even add to the description of your work. Have comments on an existing study? We’ve got you covered – add comments to the publications and even answer public questions or engage in private conversations with members about any study listed on HealthTap.

When a patient is looking for your specific expertise, they will send you a private message. You will have the opportunity to reply and get reimbursed for your time and effort. Reimbursement is based on a fixed rate per initial reply and follow ups. You have the potential to earn from $100–$200/hour with typical usage.
When an individual asks you a direct question, their basic information will appear at the top of the screen. Click their name to see their Health Activity and Health Profile.

If you wish to answer this private message, just click the Answer button. If you don't wish to or aren't able to respond within 72 hours, you can instead click the "Sorry, I cannot help you" button below. Responding in a timely fashion will improve your Responsiveness and your DocScore.

When you provide information that really hits the mark, you are likely to get a “Thank You” in return. Each “Thanks” that you receive gives your Helpfulness a boost! On the other hand, responses that are deemed to have missed the target will potentially be marked as “Not Helpful” and will result in a decrease in Helpfulness. You are more likely to get new private messages if you have a higher Helpfulness score.

If you accept private messages through HealthTap, it is important either to answer questions as you receive them or to indicate that you cannot help right now. If you respond one way or the other within 72 hours, you will maintain a high Responsiveness score. You are more likely to receive new private messages if you have a higher Responsiveness rating.

If you do not wish to respond, or cannot respond within 72 hours, you have the option of respectfully declining the message (by clicking “Sorry, can’t help right now”) and referring it to a colleague. Responding one way or the other preserves your Responsiveness rating.

Your reputation, dictated by your activity and engagement in specific areas on HealthTap, is an important variable in how patients find and connect to you. Patients can filter their searches based on what's important to them.

After searching and filtering, matching doctors are shown in a list that patients can interact. DocScore, Known fors and other important data are shown in a snapshot. One click brings patients to your Virtual Practice or allows them to follow your updates and answers that patients can interact with.

This is where you create Answers to questions on HealthTap. Answers should be concise (400 characters or less), friendly, and helpful. Add Topic tags to improve the visibility and accuracy of your Answers.

When an individual asks you a question, their age, gender, location and relation to your Known fors will become visible to you. You will also be able to see if the individual if this patient is in your HealthTap network.

Quickly and easily bring your answers to life by adding pictures and video from your own photo library or the internet. Appropriate images can be used to emphasize the meaning of the information you are providing.

At HealthTap, we value trust and quality. That’s why we identify select top doctors in every specialty, and highlight them to patients and peers. We also provide these doctors with special privileges on HealthTap, including membership in ClubMD and status as a HealthTap Scholar.

ClubMD members are doctors who regularly participate on HealthTap, and whose peers agree that the content they create and curate is high quality. Membership in this invitation-only club comes with privileges: doctors receive a ClubMD badge on their profile, are highlighted to patients, and help identify and influence the ranking of content on HealthTap.

HealthTap Scholars are a highly select group of leading doctors, and include the most engaged, respected, and helpful experts on HealthTap. The training, career accomplishments, and overall enthusiasm for HealthTap and its mission set these leaders apart. Members of this invitation-only group, identified by the Scholar badge on their profile, play a key role in curating the world’s best health information online.

Doctors who are members of the exclusive HealthTap Editorial Board are shaping the future of mobile health through their app recommendations and expert review of health information and services. Doctors who apply or are invited to join the Editorial board guide millions of people to medically accurate and helpful mobile apps and information.

The HealthTap Medical School Competition is a friendly inter-school rivalry that highlights you, your classmates, and you alma mater and benefits millions of people everywhere. The challenge centers around the number of people helped on HealthTap, and having more participants gives you a greater chance of rising to the top - so rally your school by inviting alumni to join you in the competition.

The top medical schools will be awarded with special recognition from HealthTap and all participating alumni will be recognized for their contributions, compassion, and expertise. Don't miss your opportunity to become a part of history!

You’ve seen it all firsthand as a mom — chickenpox at the age of 2, strep throat at the age of 5, a broken arm at 7, and countless runny noses. Your combined personal and professional experience as a “Doctor Mom” equips you with unique knowledge that enables you to truly connect with other moms. Ask a Doctor Mom

The HealthTap Developer Network hosted the first-ever Interactive Health Hack-a-thon ("hacking4health") in 2010. The event was a runaway hit with Silicon Valley developers who gathered in HealthTap's office to build innovative data-based health apps.
"HealthTap's developer team is smart, agile and builds to your needs. Want to retrieve the data in a certain way that they don't support? They will work with you until you have a solution."

"Software developers have never had access to such a rich set of customized health data. HealthTap's API will serve as the de-facto data platform for third-party developers to leverage as they embark on an effort to revolutionize health care."

"We love the power that HealthTap unleashes to doctors and patients – and we wanted the reproduce that functionality for our community. So rather than re-inventing the wheel, we plugged our users directly into their service, and are unlocking the power of doctor-patient interaction right within our own web portal. Integration took us a fraction of the time it would have taken us to develop an inferior solution from scratch."
After approval, you'll receive a private API key, full documentation, and a liaison on our Product & Engineering team to support you throughout your integration.

SmartHealth
What is "SmartHealth"?

SmartHealth is an extension of the Waikato DHB that allows the Waikato DHB to provide some of its health services in a virtualised manner (e.g. – the clinician and the patient can meet virtually via a computer, tablet, or smartphone rather than being in the same room face to face).
Q & A / Inform

The Q & A / Inform service allows registered users to login to SmartHealth and search existing answers provided by qualified clinicians to health related questions. It also allows users to anonymously type in new questions that can then be answered by one or more qualified clinicians. Don't include information that identifies you (like your name) in questions posted to the QA / Inform area. Remember, doctors answering these questions will not see your Profile, so if your question requires a personal response, please do a virtual consult.
There are two types of virtual consultations: Text and Video. All consultations are pre-booked appointments where a clinician and patient meet virtually through SmartHealth.
At Waikato District Health Board ("Waikato DHB"), your privacy is important to us. This document gives you details about SmartHealth and how your information will be used and kept secure.
Information that you provide or that your carer(s) provide to you while using SmartHealth services will be used to deliver health information and services to you and provide you with better care.

When you sign up to use SmartHealth, you will be asked to provide a range of information about yourself. This information along with your email address and password becomes your "Profile". The information that you will be asked for includes:

The minimum information that you must provide in order to use SmartHealth services are your name, email address and password. Giving more information will help your carer(s) provide you with better services and help you get more accurate information when using some of the self-service options within SmartHealth.

A "Consult" within SmartHealth system will allow you to have either a video (using a computer, a video camera and a microphone) consultation or a typed / text consultation with a Waikato DHB clinician. During the consultation, the Waikato DHB clinician will update information about the consultation (e.g. information they provided you during the consultation such as diagnosis or treatment). This information will be stored in SmartHealth system and also sent to update your clinical record maintained at Waikato DHB and the Primary Health Organisation (e.g. your GP) that you are registered with, just as if they saw you in person.

A cookie is a tiny little file that's stored on your computer. It contains the address of the Web site and codes that your internet browser sends back to the Web site each time you visit a page there. Cookies from SmartHealth do not contain personal information or anything dangerous; they are useful in making your experience with SmartHealth a better experience. When you browse the Web and access a Web page, the Web server needs to know who you are if you want to do things that require logging in or putting items in a virtual shopping cart or completing any other process that requires that the Web site remember information about you as you move from page to page.
The information that you enter into SmartHealth will be used to provide you:
Reminders (email and mobile notifications) to help you stay engaged with your health. You can manage the frequency and types of communications you receive by updating your account Settings.
The information that you enter into SmartHealth will be used by clinician(s):

The information that you provide in your profile along with the information that the clinicians record while providing you services via SmartHealth will be stored in one or more of the following places:

On a private, safe and highly secured computer storage system in the United States of America (called a "Cloud"). This system meets the information security standards of the United States of America and New Zealand.
On the secure clinical records systems maintained by the Waikato DHB. The same as if you met with a clinician face to face.

On the secure clinical records systems of your Primary Health Organisation (such as a GP practice), if you are registered with one of these organisations. The same as if you met with a GP face to face.
In order to meet both the New Zealand government and the Waikato DHB regulations, your information will be stored for up to 20 years following the date of your last treatment or care.

Generally only your team of clinicians from the Waikato DHB and your Primary Health Organisation will have access to your information. However, on occasion SmartHealth staff, Waikato DHB staff or others authorised by the Waikato DHB may also need to access your information in order to ensure that the system is working correctly, to fix any issues that might arise and/or to respond to any complaints, questions or concerns.

Modern medicine and healthcare too often emphasize “health” over “care,” focusing more on treatments and medications than on the human aspect of care. As patients, we have few opportunities to show our appreciation for the doctors who help us during challenging times.

“Thanks doc!” is multimedia art installation taking viewers on a symbolic journey of care and gratitude, and highlighting the impact of caring for others by sharing knowledge and showing compassion. The piece uses actual words of thanks that patients have shared with doctors, demonstrating the often unspoken appreciation we feel for the doctors who help us overcome adversity and tend to us when we need it most.

The series of 18 panels (above) combines images of doctors with thank-you notes from patients. The installation was first displayed at the Stanford MedicineX Conference at the Stanford School of Medicine on September 29–30, 2012.
Artists: Ron Gutman and Kathleen Donahue
HealthTap is a brilliant example of high-tech, high-touch medicine: social technology directly connecting practitioners and patients. Building relationships

As a patient consulting with doctors on HealthTap, you agree to engage with the practitioner in a respectful and appropriate manner. You agree to refrain from using inappropriate language and/or behavior.
You agree that you may not make demands for treatment in a consultation. Please understand that there are three types of virtual consults on HealthTap:

Standard virtual consults: In these consults, doctors who have accepted you as a patient (whether for “on call” care, unless you already have an ongoing care relationship with the doctor) can provide care. You may receive an examination (within the limits of virtual care), provide a medical history, obtain an assessment from a physician, and receive a treatment plan as determined to be medically appropriate by the consulting doctor.

Introductory Consult: this is the first interaction with a new doctor or a doctor who has not yet accepted you as a patient on HealthTap. An introductory consult is not intended for the doctor to give you care. Introductory consults are for providing you with information or get to know the doctor and to determine if she or he can help you with your health concern (in person and/or through virtual consults). A doctor may need to invite you to her or his office for an in person appointment in order to accept you as a patient on HealthTap.

Second opinion consult: this is a consult in which a doctor can provide you with information about a health issue or a second opinion on a prior diagnosis. A new diagnosis, treatment, or other care are not available in a second opinion consult.

HealthTap is intended to give you easy access to health information (and even care) on your computer or mobile device. As a HealthTap patient (with a HealthTap Prime membership or other access to consulting doctors on HealthTap), you are entitled to receive medically necessary and appropriate care, and you agree not to abuse or overuse the access to doctors provided to you. Overuse includes requests for multiple opinions on single medical condition HealthTap consults should not be used : to obtain numerous opinions on a single medical condition. In general, doctors may discourage this practice and may be hesitant to provide an assessment to those patients who attempt to seek multiple consults. In cases where there is an absolute medical necessity, it may be appropriate to do more than one consult in a day about a specific health issue, but you may also need to consider seeking in-person care or emergency services if the level of severity truly is at the point where multiple consults are warranted (especially if in-person care is recommended by a consulting doctor on HealthTap).

Even if you believe you need a prescription or lab test, you should not expect a prescription or lab test order from any given consult. Patients who are located outside the U.S. may receive prescription recommendations only; lab orders are not currently possible for patients located outside the U.S. If the practitioner deems it appropriate to prescribe treatment or order lab tests for the condition discussed in a virtual consult, then the prescription or lab test(s) may be ordered by the physician. Lab tests are currently ordered using Quest Diagnostics lab test services; it may not be possible to order all of Quest Diagnostics lab tests (if any) in all U.S. states at this time. . The following medication categories cannot be prescribed or recommended in virtual consults on HealthTap: DEA category I-IV medications, lifestyle medications (such as weight loss or hair loss medication), and U.S.-state regulated medications. It may be possible to get prescriptions for some psychiatric medications in HealthTap Concierge virtual consults, but doctors cannot prescribe psychiatric medications in HealthTap Prime virtual consults.

There are cases when you may present with a condition that is long-standing for which you may have been taking a prescription for a long period of time. Even in this situation, it is up to the consulting doctor’s medical expertise and discretion to decide to order that prescription and for what duration. Please understand that in HealthTap Prime virtual consults, you and the doctor most likely do not have an established doctor-patient relationship, and best practice will be for the doctor to prescribe (if at all) a short-course of medication to hold you over until you are able to consult with your established doctor.

About the reviews & methodology

With more than 65,742 doctors in HealthTap’s Medical Expert Network, we have 1,623,598 years of clinical experience on tap. We have asked our doctors to use this experience to rate the effectiveness and clinical usefulness of thousands of medications for medical conditions and other indications.
The result: HealthTap RateRx, the world’s first (and only) large-scale doctor rating of the effectiveness of drugs and treatments.

A new, independent resource for doctors and patients alike, RateRx presents ratings of medication effectiveness as reported by thousands of U.S.-licensed doctors in clinical practice in more than 137 specialties. RateRx is the first national survey of U.S.-licensed doctors, soliciting independent feedback from physicians across the country about their real-world clinical experience treating a broad range of common conditions, and rating the medications used in those treatments. RateRx represents the first comprehensive assessment of what experienced clinicians in each specialty actually use in the care of patients with specific conditions. Unlike other studies, which may report on the clinical effectiveness of treatments under controlled circumstances, RateRx calls on the deep, long-term, real-world experience of top doctors to reveal which treatments doctors have learned actually work with patients.
The RateRx study was conducted by HealthTap. HealthTap collects extensive information from doctors on, among other topics, the treatments of all health-related issues.

Doctors were asked to rate the clinical effectiveness of a drug for treating a condition on a scale of 1 to 5 stars. Based on their knowledge from clinical experience using the drug for that indication, contributing doctors were instructed to rate medications for their use with specific indications. The combined ratings for each treatment have been summarized into an aggregate rating that reflects doctors’ collective experiences. The profiles of all doctors who provided ratings are publicly visible, and anyone can review details of the doctors’ training and experiences, including their specialties and board certifications.

Participation in this study was open to all U.S.-licensed doctors in good standing. More than 567,000 doctors were invited to participate in the study (includes more than 67,000 doctors in the HealthTap Medical Expert Network plus 500,000 U.S.-licensed doctors in HealthTap’s extended doctor community). In addition to those doctors invited to contribute to the study, any U.S.-licensed doctor in good standing was eligible to participate by submitting a request to HealthTap.

Doctors could rate any medication for its effectiveness in treating any condition. For common conditions, medications known to be treatments for the conditions were presented alongside the conditions. Doctors could add ratings for any new medication treatments not already included in the list.

RateRx results display each treatment for an indication in an ordered rank, based on average weighted ratings, from highest-rated to lowest, and only when there are sufficient data for a meaningful weighted average. The weighted average takes into account both the average rating and the number of ratings, discounting higher average ratings that are based on a smaller number of assessments.

To ensure unbiased doctor evaluations, doctors do not see their colleagues’ existing contributions until after they have entered their own rating. Recommendations cannot be changed once submitted, but after ratings are submitted, doctors can view the ratings of other doctors and comment on these. Both patients and doctors can learn from the RateRx ratings system. Patients benefit from the collective wisdom shared by these doctors, enabling them to see how different treatments for the same conditions are rated and reviewed. Doctors benefit from their colleagues’ ratings and comments, and are able to interpret them by referring to the contributing doctors’ practice profiles (which show their education and experience, their specialty training, years in practice, DocScore, and their "Known-for" topics).

Comments, which are optional, are often used by doctors to qualify or explain ratings, or to share details of how medications are used for each indication. Comments are available to read and review, but do not change the numeric value of the rating.

Ratings are based on generic drug names, but brand names are presented to permit doctors to rate specific drugs. Brand names are shown for every generic medication name presented. This study does not differentiate ratings between different brand names for the same medication.

The most common medication treatments for each condition are listed for ratings, but doctors were encouraged to add treatments for any indication, ensuring the inclusion of new or novel treatments for each condition. Doctors were instructed to add medications not previously on the list of standard treatment only if they had experience using the medication to treat the condition at issue and found these medication effective in the treatment of that condition.

RateRx is a living work. As an open and ongoing feature on the HealthTap platform, any U.S.-licensed doctor in good standing can contribute to this data at any time. RateRx data reflect the ongoing feedback and ratings provided by doctors based on their real-world use of medications in treating patients, serving as a unique, continuously updated resource for the efficacy of both existing and new treatments.

A difference of less than 0.5 stars between treatments may not be statistically significant or meaningful. Differences of greater than 0.5 stars between two treatments displayed are always statistically significant. The weighted average rating is a Bayesian estimate of the true average rating, given the observed ratings so far. The formula combines the global mean rating (3.3 stars) with the observations as follows:
(r = estimate of average rating, q = number of ratings, μ = average of the observed ratings):

Like most online services, HealthTap uses cookies. All browser cookies we use are encrypted. We use session ID cookies and persistent cookies to enable you to sign in and to help personalize HealthTap for you. Using cookies simplifies the delivery of relevant content and allows you to retrieve information you previously provided making use of HealthTap features easier. We link the information we store in session cookies to personally identifiable information you submit while on HealthTap. You have the ability to accept or decline cookies. Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline some or all cookies if you prefer. If you choose to decline all cookies, you may not be able to use interactive features of HealthTap or other websites that depend on cookies.

. A HealthTap doctor can help determine if you meet these criteria.

The CDC and the United States Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) recommend that Baby Boomers (those born 1945–1965) and high-risk individuals get a simple blood test to screen for Hepatitis C Virus (HCV). If left untreated Hepatitis C can cause liver damage, cirrhosis, liver failure, and other medical problems. If you meet screening guidelines,

Affiliate wishes to promote Company’s services (“Affiliate’s Promotion”), described below (“Promoted Services”), and disseminate a customized Affiliate link provided to Affiliate by the company (“Affiliate Link”) to a landing page on the Company’s website and mobile apps (“Company Apps”) through which consumers can pay for the Promoted Services. Affiliate’s Promotion may take place through Affiliate’s website, apps, social media accounts, or other channels (“Affiliate Channels”).

a. Company shall provide Affiliate with a custom Affiliate Link directed to a specific landing page (the “Affiliate Landing Page”) on the Company’s website and/or mobile apps (the “Company Apps”). Affiliate agrees that Affiliate is only entitled to compensation, as further set forth herein, for customer sign ups generated directly from this Affiliate Link.

c. Commissions are held for a period of 2 months from any purchase to protect Company in the event of any chargeback that may occur. Company shall pay all Commissions accrued and payable to Affiliate within fifteen (15) days of the first day of each month after such holdback period (the “Commission Payment Date”). Company may withhold any Commission payments as well as any actual chargeback fees for which the Company is liable that are generated through transactions from sign ups through the Affiliate Link (“Affiliate Chargeback Fees”), from any Commission Payments to Affiliate. If at any time Affiliate’s Commission Payments balance is negative as a result of Affiliate Chargeback Fees, Company may suspend or terminate the Affiliate Link or Affiliate’s participation in the Affiliate Program.

d. If on any Commission Payment Date, the amount of total Commissions accrued and payable to Affiliate is less than $25.00, then such accrued and payable balance shall be held over to the following month, and paid together with the Commissions due for that month. If at any time, the balance of accrued and payable Commissions is held over for 2 consecutive months, then Company shall pay all accrued and payable Commissions to Affiliate in the third month, regardless of the total amount owed. Payment is made via the Affiliate PayPal account or other account permitted by Company. Affiliate is responsible for any payment processing or PayPal fees associated with delivery and receipt of payment and understands and agrees that payments received will be reduced by any such fees..
f. Nothing in this agreement guarantees that Affiliate will be successful or make any money under the program. Affiliate understands that no compensation is guaranteed for any efforts made.

b. Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time and for any cause. The Company may terminate this Agreement without notice. The Affiliate must give written notice to Company at least 30 days prior to the intended date of termination.

HealthTap Prime is not health insurance and is not a substitute for health insurance.

“With a newborn child, it’s hard to do anything or go anywhere such as the medical centre. This app save me the time it would take to go to the doctor when it's not necessary. Notices shall be directed to the party’s current known address, and if by email to HealthTap, to: notice@healthtap.com.

The License and Subscription Fee shall be the License and Subscription Fee Percentage. The License and Subscription Fee Percentage is a percentage of the Conversation Fee that ranges between Twenty and Twenty-Five Percent of the Conversation Fee based on the DocScore of the Subscriber. Each separate transaction in a Private Conversation, such as a question and a follow up question, shall each be subject to a Conversation Fee.

The Term of this Addendum shall be effective as of the commencement of the term of the Agreement, shall automatically renew with the Agreement, and shall terminate when the Agreement terminates. If this Addendum is amended, the Addendum shall renew as Amended.

. The TRUSTe program covers only information that is collected through this Web site.
